page.title: 10Minera Quarry to motorway
page.content: High explosive is placed into holes drilled into the rock.Detonators are attached and the explosion will bring down thousands of tons of rock.The stone is loaded into huge trucks by mechanical shovels.It goes to the crushing plant where big pieces are broken.It goes through other crushers and it gets sorted into batches of different sized aggregate which are stored in hoppers. Asphalt,which is used in road making ,is made at the quarry.The right amount of aggregate is mixed with a binder.The binder is bitumen, which is a tar-like substance which comes from crude petroleum refining.It is brought to the quarry in large tankers. Rock and asphalt from Minera Quarry have been used to construct motorways like the M.56 and the M.53.
